definition: to dispatch sb to do sth/to make sb leave/to pass (the time)/(old) to make arrangements/(old) to bestow (alms etc)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to pass the time

sentences.english: Perhaps they spent time in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们在院子里打发时光。
12我已经打发推基古往以弗所去。

sentences.english: That's good. I was just wondering about how to spend my free time on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 太好了，我正在想怎么打发我的周末时间呢？

sentences.english: 17From Miletus, Paul sent to Ephesus for the elders of the church.
sentences.chinese: 保罗从米利都打发人往以弗所去，请教会的长老来。

sentences.english: They sent therefore fifty men； and they sought three days， but found him not.
sentences.chinese: 他们便打发五十人去，寻梢了三天，也没有找着。

sentences.english: I entertained myself flicking wheat-based projectiles at the cat.
sentences.chinese: 我把小面团当成子弹弹向那只猫，以此来打发时间。

sentences.english: The rest of the men he sent back to their homes.
sentences.chinese: 其馀的人扫罗都打发各回各家去了。

sentences.english: But experience had taught him not to proffer academic work as an excuse.
sentences.chinese: 不过经验告诉他，文化课作业打发不了爸爸的要求。

sentences.english: Come, I am going to send you to them.
sentences.chinese: 你来，我要打发你往他们那里去。

sentences.english: And he traveled by train. And so to pass the time, he would play solitaire.
sentences.chinese: 他坐火车旅行，为了打发时间，他会玩纸牌。

sentences.english: I have more squires than I know what to do with.
sentences.chinese: 我的侍从多的不知道该打发他们去干什么。

sentences.english: It's called Cubix! It's stupid and pointless but good for killing time.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很无聊也没有什么意义，但值得打发时间。

sentences.english: These are the names of the men which Moses sent to spy out the land.
sentences.chinese: 这就是摩西所打发，窥探那地之人的名字。

sentences.english: Check it out — it can help your otherwise dreary workday go a little faster.
sentences.chinese: 试一下这个网站，它能帮助你快一点打发工作时间。

sentences.english: He lounged away the whole night in the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他在酒吧打发了整个晚上。

sentences.english: Romance is every time I eat a bowl of left Douer you will help me to pass out.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是我每次吃饭留下的碗兜儿你都会帮我打发掉。

definition: to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
to disturb/to annoy/to mix/to stir
to chat/idle talk
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to send sb away (with an excuse)
to kill time
thus/in this way/like this
bored/boring/senseless
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
to be chattersome/to talk on and on without stopping/to nag
to chat/casual conversation
to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
